Log Into the Supercomputer

bash ssh <username>@ssh.fsl.byu.edu

Make directory for potential analyses

bash mkdir -p ~/compute/projects/corticalthickness/data mkdir -p ~/compute/projects/tbm/data mkdir -p ~/compute/projects/vbm/data

Sync Template Directory

bash rsync \ -rauv \ ~/fsl_groups/fslg_byustudent/templates/ \ ~/templates

Copy Files and Add Subject ID to Filename

Copy cortical thickness normalized to template images:

bash for subj in $(ls ~/compute/data); do SUBJ_DIR=~/compute/data/${subj}/antsCorticalThickness/ cp -v \ ${SUBJ_DIR}/CorticalThicknessNormalizedToTemplate.nii.gz \ ~/compute/projects/corticalthickness/data/${subj}.nii.gz done

Copy log Jacobian images:

bash for subj in $(ls ~/compute/data); do SUBJ_DIR=~/compute/data/${subj}/antsCorticalThickness/ cp -v \ ${SUBJ_DIR}/SubjectToTemplateLogJacobian.nii.gz \ ~/compute/projects/tbm/data/${subj}.nii.gz done

Generate Normalized GM Images

bash for subj in $(ls ~/compute/data); do SUBJ_DIR=~/compute/data/${subj}/antsCorticalThickness ~/apps/c3d/bin/c3d \ ${SUBJ_DIR}/BrainNormalizedToTemplate.nii.gz \ ~/templates/NKI10andUnder/T_template0_GMMask.nii.gz \ -multiply \ -o ${SUBJ_DIR}/GMSegmented.nii.gz done

Modulate GM Images

bash for subj in $(ls ~/compute/data); do SUBJ_DIR=~/compute/data/${subj}/antsCorticalThickness ~/apps/c3d/bin/c3d \ ${SUBJ_DIR}/GMSegmented.nii.gz \ ${SUBJ_DIR}/SubjectToTemplateLogJacobian.nii.gz \ -multiply \ -o ${SUBJ_DIR}/GMModulated.nii.gz done

Copy Images

bash for subj in $(ls ~/compute/data); do cp -v \ ~/compute/data/${subj}/antsCorticalThickness/GMModulated.nii.gz \ ~/compute/projects/vbm/data/${subj}.nii.gz done
